dt.t: … the changing {wi}nomenclature{/wi} of her streets is even more baffling …

dt: {bc}the act or process or an instance of naming

dt.t: {wi}nomenclature{/wi} … is at its simplest the task of assigning a name to each distinct species

dt: {bc}a system or set of terms or symbols especially in a particular science, discipline, or art
{bc}an international system of standardized New Latin names used in biology for kinds and groups of kinds of animals and plants

et: borrowed from Latin {it}nōmenclātūra{/it} "assigning of names to things," from {it}nōmen{/it} "name" + {it}calātus,{/it} past participle of {it}calāre{/it} "to announce, proclaim" + {it}-ūra{/it} {et_link|-ure|-ure} {ma}{mat|name:1|}, {mat|low:3|}{/ma}
The Latin word is formed after earlier {it}nōmenclātor{/it} "slave tasked with telling his master the names of clients and others encountered publicly"—see {et_link|nomenclator|nomenclator}.
shortdef: the act or process or an instance of naming
a system or set of terms or symbols especially in a particular science, discipline, or art

dt: {bc}a system of nomenclature in which each species of animal or plant receives a name of two terms of which the first identifies the genus to which it belongs and the second the species itself

shortdef: a system of nomenclature in which each species of animal or plant receives a name of two terms of which the first identifies the genus to which it belongs and the second the species itself
